title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Ecuador is efficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Ecuador is efficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Chile has the comparative advantage in the production of fish and/or does not explain that Chile has the lower opportunity cost in producing fish: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of fish in Chile is 0.1 unit of melon and in Ecuador it is 0.33 unit of melon.

The response states that Chile has the comparative advantage in the production of fish and explains that Chile has the lower opportunity cost in producing fish: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of fish in Chile is 0.1 unit of melon and in Ecuador it is 0.33 unit of melon.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, Ecuador will gain from trade and/or does not explain that these terms of trade are greater than Ecuador’s opportunity cost of producing melons.
The response states that yes, Ecuador will gain from trade and explains that these terms of trade are greater than Ecuador’s opportunity cost of producing melons.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Ecuador’s opportunity cost of producing fish will decrease and/or does not explain that it will give up fewer units of melons to produce each unit of fish.
The response states that Ecuador’s opportunity cost of producing fish will decrease and explains that it will give up fewer units of melons to produce each unit of fish.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of employed people in Chile as 18 million and/or does not show the work.
